result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley William Sammer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA and any victim surcharges); All applicable fees of supervision this can be based on a budget plan. Pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% o funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION, IF REVOKED:
- No Contact with any victims specified in the criminal complaint or their residence.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers as deemed appropriate.
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment/education/vocation.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with an yother treatment deemed necessary by the deaprtment.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 4  YEARS and 6 MONTHS with 93 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court stayed the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
-No contact with any victims specified in the criminal complaint or their residence.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers as deemed appropriate.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and any victim surcharges); 
All applicable fees of supervision this can be based on a budget plan.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Bradley William Sammer in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Bradley William Sammer in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Bradley William Sammer not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense no longer wishes to have a bail review today. Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bradley William Sammer in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Bradley William Sammer in custody.  Ronald Dague for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Sharif Said-West Allis Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail Bond Hearing May 22, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with REBECCA M. AND DERRICK G.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bradley William Sammer in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Bradley William Sammer in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Motion to dismiss by defense FOR LACK OF PROBABLE CAUSE argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

COURT ORDERS SHERIFF DEPARTMENT TO OBTAIN DNA SAMPLE.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
